get.description: Return an array with the ids of the currently active repairs

post.description: Invoke repair asynchronously. You can track repair progress by using the get supplying id

parameters.name: keyspace
parameters.description: The keyspace to repair

parameters.name: primaryRange
parameters.description: If the value is the string 'true' with any capitalization, repair only the first range returned by the partitioner.

parameters.name: parallelism
parameters.description: Repair parallelism, can be 0 (sequential), 1 (parallel) or 2 (datacenter-aware).

parameters.name: incremental
parameters.description: If the value is the string 'true' with any capitalization, perform incremental repair.

parameters.name: jobThreads
parameters.description: An integer specifying the parallelism on each node.

parameters.name: ranges
parameters.description: An explicit list of ranges to repair, overriding the default choice. Each range is expressed as token1:token2, and multiple ranges can be given as a comma separated list.

parameters.name: startToken
parameters.description: Token on which to begin repair

parameters.name: endToken
parameters.description: Token on which to end repair

parameters.name: columnFamilies
parameters.description: Which column families to repair in the given keyspace. Multiple columns families can be named separated by commas. If this option is missing, all column families in the keyspace are repaired.

parameters.name: dataCenters
parameters.description: Which data centers are to participate in this repair. Multiple data centers can be listed separated by commas.

parameters.name: hosts
parameters.description: Which hosts are to participate in this repair. Multiple hosts can be listed separated by commas.

parameters.name: trace
parameters.description: If the value is the string 'true' with any capitalization, enable tracing of the repair.

parameters.name: keyspace
parameters.description: The keyspace repair is running on

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The repair ID to check for status

post.description: Force terminate all repair sessions
Force terminate all repair sessions

set the logging level at runtime

If both classQualifer and level are empty/null, it will reload the configuration to reset.
If classQualifer is not empty but level is empty/null, it will set the level to null for the defined classQualifer
If level cannot be parsed, then the level will be defaulted to DEBUG

The logback configuration should have < jmxConfigurator /> set

Truncates (deletes) the given columnFamily from the provided keyspace. Calling truncate results in actual deletion of all data in the cluster under the given columnFamily and it will fail unless all hosts are up. All data in the given column family will be deleted, but its definition will not be affected.

collectd_metric_status.title: collectd_metric_status
collectd_metric_status.description: Holds a collectd id and an enable flag

version_value.title: version_value
version_value.description: Holds a version value for an application state

endpoint_phi_value.description: Holds phi value for a single end point

mapper_list.description: Holds a key value which is a list

map_string_double.description: A key value mapping between a string and a double

maplist_mapper.description: A key value mapping, where key and value are list

enable.description: Is slow query logging enable or disable

ttl.description: The slow query TTL in seconds

threshold.description: The slow query logging threshold in microseconds. Queries that takes longer, will be logged

files.description: Number of files to transfer. Can be 0 if nothing to transfer for some streaming request.

progress_info_mapper.description: A mapping between file and its progress info

sample.description: A sample containing the last n elements

bucket_offsets.description: The series of values to which the counts in `buckets` correspond

count.description: Total number of events from startup
